sentences.en: " Ah , yes, " thought Braille. " I know what that is. I know only too well! "
sentences.cn: “ 是呀, ” 布莱叶暗自想道, “ 我知道那是什么, 知道得太清楚了. ”

sentences.en: " I must talk to this captain. I must learn more about night writing, " Braille said.
sentences.cn: “ 我得和这位上尉谈谈,我必须对‘夜间文字’有进一步的了解. ” 布莱叶说道.

sentences.en: A few days later Braille died. He was only forty - three years old.
sentences.cn: 几天后,布莱叶先生去世,年仅43岁.

sentences.en: At the convention this statistic was frequently cited with pride, so much so that those who didn’t know Braille were sometimes made to feel like outsiders.
sentences.cn: 在国家盲人联合会的年会上，这个研究数据经常被引用，以至于那些没学过布莱叶的人觉得自己像个局外人。

sentences.en: Books are now printed in braille.
sentences.cn: 很多书现在都用盲文印.

sentences.en: Braille and sign language services shall be given due emphasis.
sentences.cn: 注重盲文和哑语的服务.

sentences.en: Braille is the name of the man and the code that gave windows to the blind.
sentences.cn: 布莱叶虽只是个人名,但也是给盲人带来光明的一种代号.

sentences.en: Braille took a job at the school for the blind in Paris.
sentences.cn: 布莱叶在巴黎的一所盲人学校找到了工作.

sentences.en: Braille used raised dots, just as in night writing.
sentences.cn: 在代码中,布莱叶使用突起的小点, 就像“夜间文字”中所用的小点一样.

sentences.en: For 150 years, Braille books were designed to function as much as possible like print books.
sentences.cn: 150年来，布莱叶盲文书籍设计的功能尽可能做到与印刷图书相同。

sentences.en: He read the letter in braille , and could not help looking happy.
sentences.cn: 他用手读着这封盲信, 不禁露出了喜悦的表情.

sentences.en: My fingers scan a book in braille.
sentences.cn: 我的手指扫描着一本盲文书.

sentences.en: Suddenly the meaning of this code hit Braille.
sentences.cn: 布莱叶突然发现了这种符号的意义.

sentences.en: The child was Louis Braille. He would never see again.
sentences.cn: 那孩子名叫路易-布莱叶, 他再也看不见东西了.

sentences.en: There are books printed in braille.
sentences.cn: 现在还有用布莱叶盲文印的书.

sentences.en: To transliterate from a published work into Braille for publication.
sentences.cn: 将已经发表的作品改成盲文出版.

trans.tran_en: Braille is a system of printing for blind people. The letters are printed as groups of raised dots that you can feel with your fingers.
